question: Will Tim Peterson win the MN-5 Democratic House District?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Tim Peterson wins the 2024 Democratic Primary for the 5th Minnesota Congressional District (MN-5). Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

If no 2024 Democratic Primary for the 5th Minnesota Congressional District (MN-5) takes place this market will resolve to “No”. 

The resolution source for this market will be the first announcement of the results from the Minnesota Democratic Primary, however an overwhelming consensus of credible reporting may suffice.

events.title: MN-5 Democratic Primary Winner
events.description: This is a market on predicting the winner of the MN-5 Democratic Primary election.

question: Will another candidate win the MN-5 Democratic House District?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if any candidate other than Ilhan Omar, Sarah Gad, Tim Peterson, or Don Samuels wins the 2024 Democratic Primary for the 5th Minnesota Congressional District (MN-5). Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

If no 2024 Democratic Primary for the 5th Minnesota Congressional District (MN-5) takes place this market will resolve to “Yes”. 

The resolution source for this market will be the first announcement of the results from the Minnesota Democratic Primary, however an overwhelming consensus of credible reporting may suffice.

events.title: MN-5 Democratic Primary Winner
events.description: This is a market on predicting the winner of the MN-5 Democratic Primary election.

question: Martin Shkreli jail in 2024?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Martin Shkreli serves any time in a federal, state, or local U.S. jail or prison between June 17 and December 31, 2024, by 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the U.S. Government, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: VP debate before election?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the 2024 US Vice Presidential nominees from the Democratic and Republican parties engage in a live, publicly-broadcast debate by November 4, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Both in-person debates and virtual debates will count toward a "Yes" resolution for this market.

The resolution source for this market will be footage of such a debate, however a consensus of credible sources will also be used.

events.description:

The resolution source for this market will be footage of such a debate, however a consensus of credible sources will also be used.

question: Will RFK Jr. drop out by Friday?
description:
his market will resolve to "Yes" if Robert F. Kennedy Jr. officially announces his withdrawal or is confirmed to have withdrawn from the 2024 US presidential race by 11:59 PM ET on August 9, 2024.

In the event of any extenuating circumstances that prevent Kennedy from continuing the race, this market will also resolve to "Yes".

If Kennedy does not announce his withdrawal or is not forced to withdraw from the 2024 presidential race by the specified time, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from RFK Jr. or his official/legal representatives, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Will Elon agree to stream with Adin Ross today?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" Elon Musk agrees to a stream with Adin Ross by Tuesday, August 6, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For this market to resolve to "Yes" it is only necessary that Elon Musk agree to stream with Adin Ross by the mentioned date. Whether that stream actually takes place will have no bearing on the resolution of this market

The resolution source for this market will be information from Elon Musk or his official representative, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

events.title: Will Elon agree to stream with Adin Ross today?

question: Fed decreases interest rates by 75+ bps after December 2024 meeting?
description:
The FED interest rates are defined in this market by the upper bound of the target federal funds range. The decisions on the target federal fund range are made by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meetings.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if following the Federal Reserve's December 2024 meeting the upper bound of the target federal funds rate is decreased by 75 or more basis points below the level it was prior to the meeting. Otherwise, it will resolve to “No”.

The resolution source for this market is the FOMC’s statement after its meeting scheduled for December 17 - 18, 2024 according to the official calendar: https://www.federalreserve.gov/monetarypolicy/fomccalendars.htm.

The level and change of the target federal funds rate is also published at the official website of the Federal Reserve at https://www.federalreserve.gov/monetarypolicy/openmarket.htm.

This market may resolve as soon as the FOMC’s statement for their December meeting with relevant data is issued. If no statement is released by the end date of the next scheduled meeting, this market will resolve to the "No change" bracket.

events.title: Fed decision in December?
events.description: This is a market on the anticipated Federal Reserve interest rate decision for December 2024.

question: No change in Fed interest rates after December 2024 meeting?
description:
The FED interest rates are defined in this market by the upper bound of the target federal funds range. The decisions on the target federal fund range are made by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meetings.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if following the Federal Reserve's December 2024 meeting the upper bound of the target federal funds rate is exactly the same as the level it was prior to the meeting (namely it increased 0 bps). Otherwise, it will resolve to “No”.

question: Iran military response by Friday?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between August 5 and August 9, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

In the case that the "Yes" resolution criteria are met prior to this market's resolution date, this market will resolve immediately.

question: Will Ethereum reach $3,000 before September?
description:
This market will immediately resolve to "Yes" if any Binance 1 minute candle for Ethereum (ETHUSDT) between August 6, 2024, 14:00 and August 31, 2024, 23:59 in the ET timezone has a final "High" price of $3,000.00 or higher. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

The resolution source for this market is Binance, specifically the ETHUSDT "High" prices available at https://www.binance.com/en/trade/ETH_USDT, with the chart settings on "1m" for one-minute candles selected on the top bar.

Please note that the outcome of this market depends solely on the price data from the Binance ETHUSDT trading pair. Prices from other exchanges, different trading pairs, or spot markets will not be considered for the resolution of this market.

Please note that the outcome of this market depends solely on the price data from the Binance ETHUSDT trading pair. Prices from other exchanges, different trading pairs, or spot markets will not be considered for the resolution of this market.

question: Who will raise more in July?
description:
This market will resolve to "Harris" if Kamala Harris’s campaign raises more money than Donald Trump's campaign during the period from July 1, 2024, to July 31, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to "Trump" if Donald Trump's campaign raises more money than Kamala Harris's campaign during the same period.

This market will resolve based on the "Total Receipts" reported for the period covering July 1, 2024, through July 31, 2024 found on the FEC filings.

If the campaigns raise exactly the same amount of money, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be the FEC filings submitted in August 2024 for the month of July 2024, scheduled to be released on August 20. The specific filings can be accessed via the following links: Harris’s FEC filing at https://docquery.fec.gov/cgi-bin/forms/C00703975/sa and Trump's FEC filing at https://docquery.fec.gov/cgi-bin/forms/C00828541/DJTFP24.COM.

If the FEC filings do not clearly indicate the total receipts for the specified period or if no report is filed by September 31, 2024, this market will resolve 50-50.

Note: The FEC will count all funds reported under the Biden-Harris campaign, including those raised before Joe Biden's withdrawal, as part of Kamala Harris's campaign finances.

events.title: Harris vs. Trump: Who will raise more each month?
events.description: This is a market on whether Kamala Harris or Donald Trump will raise more campaign funds in their respective future election cycles.

This market will resolve based on the "Total Receipts" reported for the period covering August 1, 2024, through August 31, 2024 found on the FEC filings.

The resolution source will be the FEC filings submitted in September 2024 for the month of August 2024, scheduled to be released on September 20. The specific filings can be accessed via the following links: Harris’s FEC filing at https://docquery.fec.gov/cgi-bin/forms/C00703975/sa and Trump's FEC filing at https://docquery.fec.gov/cgi-bin/forms/C00828541/DJTFP24.COM.

If the FEC filings do not clearly indicate the total receipts for the specified period or if no report is filed by October 31, 2024, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: Who will raise more in September?
description:
This market will resolve to "Harris" if Kamala Harris’s campaign raises more money than Donald Trump's campaign during the period from September 1, 2024, to September 30, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to "Trump" if Donald Trump's campaign raises more money than Kamala Harris's campaign during the same period.

This market will resolve based on the "Total Receipts" reported for the period covering September 1, 2024, through September 30, 2024 found on the FEC filings.

If the campaigns raise exactly the same amount of money, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be the FEC filings submitted in October 2024 for the month of September 2024, scheduled to be released on October 20. The specific filings can be accessed via the following links: Harris’s FEC filing at https://docquery.fec.gov/cgi-bin/forms/C00703975/sa and Trump's FEC filing at https://docquery.fec.gov/cgi-bin/forms/C00828541/DJTFP24.COM.

If the FEC filings do not clearly indicate the total receipts for the specified period or if no report is filed by November 30, 2024, this market will resolve 50-50.

Note: The FEC will count all funds reported under the Biden-Harris campaign, including those raised before Joe Biden's withdrawal, as part of Kamala Harris's campaign finances.

question: Will Brandon Aiyuk be traded to the Browns?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Brandon Aiyuk is traded to the Cleveland Browns by September 7th, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".  

If Brandon Aiyuk is traded to another team, this market will immediately resolve to "No". 

The resolution source for this market will be official information from the team Aiyuk is traded to, and the NFL.

events.title: Brandon Aiyuk next team?
events.description: This is a market on which NFL team Brandon Aiyuk will be playing for next season.

question: Will Brandon Aiyuk be traded to another team?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Brandon Aiyuk is traded to any NFL team other than the Cleveland Browns, New England Patriots, or Pittsburgh Steelers by September 7th, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".  

If Aiyuk is cut, retires, or is not on an NFL roster as of the resolution date this market will resolve to "Yes".

If Brandon Aiyuk is traded to the Cleveland Browns, New England Patriots, or Pittsburgh Steelers, this market will immediately resolve to "No". 

The resolution source for this market will be official information from the NFL team Aiyuk is traded to, and the NFL.

events.title: Brandon Aiyuk next team?
events.description: This is a market on which NFL team Brandon Aiyuk will be playing for next season.

question: Will Brandon Aiyuk stay on the 49ers?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Brandon Aiyuk remains on the San Francisco 49ers through September 7th, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".  

If Brandon Aiyuk is traded this market will immediately resolve to "No". 

The resolution source for this market will be official information from the NFL team Aiyuk is traded to, and the NFL.

question: Joe Biden reinstated as Dem Nominee at DNC?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the 2024 nominee of the Democratic Party for U.S. president is changed to Joe Biden at the Democratic National Convention (DNC). Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No". 

If it is officially changed to Joe Biden before the DNC this market will also resolve to "Yes."

If the DNC has concluded and Joe Biden wasn't reinstated as the nominee, this market will resolve to "No." If the DNC is cancelled or rescheduled to a date after November 4, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No". 

The primary resolution source for this market will be information from the Democratic Party and footage from the DNC, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.
